problem_text: Does there exist a finite p-group G all of whose maximal subgroups H are special, that is, satisfy Z(H) = [H, H] = Φ(H)? Ya. G. Berkovich
answer: Yes, for all primes there are groups of arbitrarily large size with this property (J. Cossey, Bull. Austral. Math. Soc., 89 (2014), 415–419); an example for p = 2 given by a Sylow 2-subgroup of L3(4) was independently presented by V. I. Zenkov at Mal’cev Meeting–2014, 10–14 November, 2014, Novosibirsk.
